analysis.project_type: Node.js/TypeScript backend WhatsApp chatbot with Express.js, Prisma, PostgreSQL, Redis

decisions.reasoning: Core framework - Express.js is the main web framework used in this project
Core language - Project is written in TypeScript 5.x
Relevant for Prisma/PostgreSQL, but contains Supabase-specific content which is not used
decisions.action_details: Remove Supabase sections, keep Prisma/PostgreSQL content

decisions.reasoning: General git workflow rules applicable to all projects
General coding principles applicable to all projects
decisions.action_details: Keep, but review for overlap with codequality.mdc

decisions.reasoning: General code quality guidelines applicable to all projects
Partially relevant - project uses CommonJS (module: commonjs in tsconfig), but some general Node.js practices apply
decisions.action_details: Keep general Node.js practices, ignore ES module specific parts

decisions.reasoning: Relevant for TypeScript code quality, but may overlap with typescript.mdc
decisions.action_details: Keep, provides additional TypeScript-specific quality guidelines

decisions.reasoning: Core testing framework - Jest is used for unit/integration tests
E2E testing framework - Playwright is used for end-to-end tests
Frontend frameworks not used - this is a backend-only project
decisions.action_details: Remove all frontend framework rules (React, Next.js, Vue, Angular, Svelte, etc.)

decisions.reasoning: Python not used - project is TypeScript/Node.js only

decisions.filename: All mobile framework rules (Android, iOS, React Native, Flutter, NativeScript)
decisions.reasoning: No mobile development - backend API only

decisions.filename: All other language rules (Go, Rust, Java, Kotlin, Scala, Elixir, etc.)
decisions.reasoning: Only TypeScript/Node.js used in this project
NestJS not used - project uses Express.js, not NestJS
decisions.action_details: Remove NestJS rules, project uses Express

decisions.reasoning: MongoDB not used - project uses PostgreSQL with Prisma
